questions.question_text:
An engineer is responsible for configuring a new firewall solution that will be deployed in a new public cloud environment. All traffic must pass through the firewall.
The SLA for the firewall is 99.999%. Which of the following should be deployed?

choices.C: Two firewalls in a HA configuration
choices.A: Two load balancers behind a single firewall

discussion.content:
C. Two firewalls in a HA configuration

Explanation:
To achieve a high SLA of 99.999% (often referred to as "five nines" uptime), you need a highly available and redundant setup. Deploying two firewalls in a High Availability (HA) configuration ensures that if one firewall fails, the other can take over without disrupting traffic, thereby maintaining continuous service.

Selected Answer: C
LOL two load balancers for one firewall. if you see that on a network, run. blue/green can help maintain HA but only during an update.

Selected Answer: C
The other options, such as load balancers, blue-green configuration, or a web application firewall, do not provide the same level of redundancy and failover capabilities as a HA firewall configuration.

Selected Answer: C
C. Two firewalls in a HA configuration

C. Two firewalls in a HA (High Availability) configuration is the best option to achieve the desired SLA of 99.999%. With a HA configuration, two firewalls are deployed and configured to work in tandem, so that if one firewall fails, the other will take over seamlessly and ensure continuous operation with minimal downtime. This helps to achieve high availability and improve reliability, which is critical for meeting the demanding SLA requirement.

High availability (HA) allows you to place two firewalls in a group and synchronize their configuration. This prevents a single point of failure on your network. The two firewalls have a heartbeat connection, which ensures failover if one of the firewalls goes down

questions.question_text: A cloud administrator is troubleshooting a highly available web application running within three containers behind a Layer 7 load balancer with a WAF inspecting all traffic. The application frequently asks the users to log in again even when the session timeout has not been reached. Which of the following should the cloud administrator configure to solve this issue?

discussion.content:
Selected Answer: D
To solve the issue of users being asked to log in again frequently even when the session timeout has not been reached in a highly available web application behind a Layer 7 load balancer with a WAF, you should **configure Load Balancer Stickiness (also known as session affinity or persistence)**.

Load balancer stickiness ensures that user requests are consistently directed to the same backend server/container, so session state is maintained. This prevents issues with users being prompted to log in again due to requests being distributed across different servers.

So, the correct answer is:

D. Load balancer stickiness

questions.question_text: A cloud solutions architect has received guidance to migrate an application from on premises to a public cloud. Which of the following requirements will help predict the operational expenditures in the cloud?

comments.content:
While maximum and minimum resource consumption (options B and C) are valuable for capacity planning and ensuring the application can handle peak loads efficiently, they may not directly translate to cost prediction. Actual hardware configuration (option D) is typically less relevant in a cloud environment since cloud services abstract away the underlying hardware.

In summary, understanding the average resource consumption provides a baseline for estimating cloud operational expenditures and making cost-effective decisions during the migration process.

discussion.content:
Selected Answer: A
To predict operational expenditures (OpEx) in the cloud when migrating an application from on-premises, the following requirement would be particularly relevant:

A. Average resource consumption

Understanding the average resource consumption of the application is essential for estimating the cost of running it in the cloud. By analyzing historical data or using monitoring tools, you can determine the average amount of CPU, memory, storage, and network resources the application uses over time. This data is crucial for selecting the right cloud instance types, storage options, and network configurations to meet performance requirements while optimizing costs.

Selected Answer: A
A. Average resource consumption

Selected Answer: A
A. RPO (Recovery Point Objective)

The Recovery Point Objective (RPO) is a crucial factor in determining the frequency of backup jobs for critical business applications. RPO represents the acceptable data loss in the event of a disaster or system failure. It defines the point in time to which data must be recovered to ensure business continuity without significant loss.
